Package io.github.asdfjkl.jchesslib

Class GameNode

java.lang.Object
io.github.asdfjkl.jchesslib.GameNode
public class GameNode extends Object
Represents a node of a game tree.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameNode()
    create a new node. the move leading to that node, the current board and the parent will all be set to null, i.e.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameNode

      public GameNode()
      create a new node. the move leading to that node, the current board and the parent will all be set to null, i.e. must set a board separately before using it

  • Method Details

    • initId

      protected static int initId()

    • addOrRemoveArrow

      public void addOrRemoveArrow(Arrow arrow)
      adds the supplied Arrow if the arrow is not already existing. If the supplied arrow already exists for this node, it will be removed instead
      Parameters:
      arrow -

    • getArrows

      public ArrayList<Arrow> getArrows()
      get all the arrows that were set for this node
      Returns:

    • addOrRemoveColoredField

      public void addOrRemoveColoredField(ColoredField coloredField)
      add the supplied coloredField if the coloredField does not exist for this node. It it was added before, it will be removed instead.
      Parameters:
      coloredField -

    • getColoredFields

      public ArrayList<ColoredField> getColoredFields()
      get all coloredFields for this node
      Returns:

    • getId

      public int getId()
      each node has a unique id that is created during object construction.
      Returns:
      the id of the node

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      get the board of this game node.
      Returns:
      the board. null if not set.

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard(Board b)
      set the board of this node to the supplied one
      Parameters:
      b -

    • getSan

      public String getSan(Move m)
      get a short algebraic notation of the supplied Move.
      Parameters:
      m - Move for which the SAN is desired
      Returns:
      String with SAN representation

    • getSan

      public String getSan()
      get a short algebraic notation of the Move that leads to this node. Will raise an error if the Move has not been set before
      Returns:
      String with SAN representation

    • getParent

      public GameNode getParent()
      get the parent of this node
      Returns:
      parent node

    • getMove

      public Move getMove()
      get the Move that leads to this node.
      Returns:
      The Move. Null if it was not set.

    • setMove

      public void setMove(Move m)
      set the Move that leads to this node.
      Parameters:
      m - The Move.

    • setParent

      public void setParent(GameNode node)
      sets the supplied node as the parent of this node.
      Parameters:
      node -

    • setComment

      public void setComment(String s)
      adds a comment
      Parameters:
      s -

    • getComment

      public String getComment()
      gets the comment of this node. Null if it was not set before
      Returns:

    • getVariation

      public GameNode getVariation(int i)
      get the node of variation i (counting from 0, where 0 is the main variation). Throws an IllegalArgumentException if that variation does not exist
      Parameters:
      i - index of the desired variation
      Returns:
      the start node of the variation

    • deleteVariation

      public void deleteVariation(int i)
      delete variation i (counting from 0, where 0 is the main variation). Throws an IllegalArgumentException if that variation does not exist.
      Parameters:
      i - index of the desired variation

    • getVariations

      public ArrayList<GameNode> getVariations()
      get all variations of the current node
      Returns:

    • addVariation

      public void addVariation(GameNode node)
      add a variation. It will become the last variation of the current node
      Parameters:
      node - the start node of the variation

    • hasVariations

      public boolean hasVariations()
      checks if the node has variations (i.e. more than one child)
      Returns:
      true if there are more than 1 children

    • hasChild

      public boolean hasChild()
      checks if the node has children
      Returns:
      true if this is not a leaf node

    • isLeaf

      public boolean isLeaf()
      checks if the node is a leaf node
      Returns:

    • addNag

      public void addNag(int n)
      add a numeric annotation glyph (cf. PGN standard)
      Parameters:
      n - the NAG encoded as an integer

    • getNags

      public ArrayList<Integer> getNags()
      get all NAGs (cf. PGN standard)
      Returns:

    • getDepth

      public int getDepth()
      the the depth of this variation from root
      Returns:

    • removeNagsInRange

      public void removeNagsInRange(int start, int stop)
      remove NAGs (numeric annotation glyphs) within a specified range greater or equal to start and smaller or equal to stop
      Parameters:
      start - starting value of the range
      stop - stop value of the range

    • sortNags

      public void sortNags()
      sort NAGs according to their integer number
